Your use of Wallet Beta is subject to our standard $1 as well as our $2. As a Beta, there may be an increased risk of bugs. editGasEducationHighExplanation: This is best for time sensitive transactions (like Swaps) as it increases the likelihood of a successful transaction. If a Swap takes too long to process it may fail and result in losing some of your gas fee.
editGasEducationLowExplanation: A lower gas fee should only be used when processing time is less important. Lower fees make it hard predict when (or if) your transaction will be successful.
editGasEducationMediumExplanation: A medium gas fee is good for sending, withdrawing or other non-time sensitive transactions. This setting will most often result in a successful transaction.
editGasEducationModalIntro: Selecting the right gas fee depends on the type of transaction and how important it is to you.
editGasLimitOutOfBounds: Gas limit must be at least $1
editGasLimitOutOfBoundsV2: Gas limit must be greater than $1 and less than $2
editGasLimitTooltip: Gas limit is the maximum units of gas you are willing to use. Units of gas are a multiplier to ‚ÄúMax priority fee‚Äù and ‚ÄúMax fee‚Äù.
editGasMaxBaseFeeGWEIImbalance: Max base fee cannot be lower than priority fee
editGasMaxBaseFeeHigh: Max base fee is higher than necessary
editGasMaxBaseFeeLow: Max base fee is low for current network conditions
editGasMaxBaseFeeMultiplierImbalance: Multiplier is low relative to Priority fee
editGasMaxFeeHigh: Max fee is higher than necessary
editGasMaxFeeLow: Max fee too low for network conditions
editGasMaxFeePriorityImbalance: Max fee cannot be lower than max priority fee
editGasMaxFeeTooltip: The max fee is the most you‚Äôll pay (base fee + priority fee).
editGasMaxPriorityFeeBelowMinimum: Max priority fee must be greater than 0 GWEI
editGasMaxPriorityFeeBelowMinimumV2: Priority fee must be greater than 0.
editGasMaxPriorityFeeHigh: Max priority fee is higher than necessary. You may pay more than needed.
editGasMaxPriorityFeeHighV2: Priority fee is higher than necessary. You may pay more than needed
editGasMaxPriorityFeeLow: Max priority fee is low for current network conditions
editGasMaxPriorityFeeLowV2: Priority fee is low for current network conditions
editGasMaxPriorityFeeTooltip: Max priority fee (aka ‚Äúminer tip‚Äù) goes directly to miners and incentivizes them to prioritize your transaction. You‚Äôll most often pay your max setting
editGasPriceTooLow: Gas price must be greater than 0
editGasPriceTooltip: This network requires a ‚ÄúGas price‚Äù field when submitting a transaction. Gas price is the amount you will pay pay per unit of gas.
editGasTooLowTooltip: Your max fee or max priority fee may be low for current market conditions. We don't know when (or if) your transaction will be processed.
editGasTooLowWarningTooltip: This lowers your maximum fee but if network traffic increases your transaction may be delayed or fail.

notifications1Description: Wallet Mobile users can now swap tokens inside their mobile wallet. Scan the QR code to get the mobile app and start swapping.
notifications3Description: Stay up to date on Wallet security best practices and get the latest security tips from official Wallet support.
notifications4Description: Get the best prices on token swaps right inside your wallet. Wallet now connects you to multiple decentralized exchange aggregators and professional market makers on Binance Smart Chain.
notifications5Description: Your "Seed Phrase" is now called your "Secret Recovery Phrase."
notifications6DescriptionOne: As of Chrome version 91, the API that enabled our Ledger support (U2F) no longer supports hardware wallets. Wallet has implemented a new Ledger Live support that allows you to continue to connect to your Ledger device via the Ledger Live desktop app.
notifications6DescriptionThree: When interacting with your Ledger account in Wallet, a new tab will open and you will be asked to open the Ledger Live app.  Once the app opens, you'll be asked to allow a WebSocket connection to your Wallet account.  That's all!
notifications6DescriptionTwo: You can enable Ledger Live support by clicking Settings > Advanced > Use Ledger Live.
notifications6Title: Ledger Support Update for Chrome Users
notifications7DescriptionOne: Wallet v10.1.0 included new support for EIP-1559 transactions when using Ledger devices.
notifications7DescriptionTwo: To complete transactions on Ethereum Mainnet, make sure your Ledger device has the latest firmware.
notifications8DescriptionOne: As of Wallet v10.4.0, you no longer need Ledger Live to connect your Ledger device to Wallet.
notifications8DescriptionTwo: For an easier and more stable ledger experience, go to the Advanced tab of settings and switch the 'Preferred Ledger Connection Type' to 'WebHID'.
notifications9DescriptionOne: We now provide you with more insights on the 'Data' tab when confirming smart contract transactions.
notifications9DescriptionTwo: You can now get a better understanding of your transaction‚Äôs details before confirming, and more easily add transaction addresses to your address book, helping you make safe and informed decisions.
notifications9Title: üëì We are making transactions easier to read.
onboardingPinExtensionBillboardDescripti: These extensions can see and change information

onlyAddTrustedNetworks: A malicious network provider can lie about the state of the blockchain and record your network activity. Only add custom networks you trust.

recoveryPhraseReminderHasBackedUp: Always keep your Secret Recovery Phrase in a secure and secret place

secretPhrase: Only the first account on this wallet will auto load. After completing this process, to add additional accounts, click the drop down menu, then select Create Account.

seedPhraseIntroSidebarBulletFour: Write down and store in multiple secret places.

seedPhraseIntroSidebarCopyTwo: Never, ever share your Secret Recovery Phrase, not even with Wallet!

signNotice: Signing this message can be dangerous. This signature could potentially perform any operation on your account's behalf, including granting complete control of your account and all of its assets to the requesting site. swapAdvancedSlippageInfo: If the price changes between the time your order is placed and confirmed it‚Äôs called ‚Äúslippage‚Äù. Your swap will automatically cancel if slippage exceeds your ‚Äúmax slippage‚Äù setting.

swapEnableDescription: This is required and gives Wallet permission to swap your $1.
swapEstimatedNetworkFeesInfo: This is an estimate of the network fee that will be used to complete your swap. The actual amount may change according to network conditions.
swapFailedErrorDescriptionWithSupportLin: Transaction failures happen and we are here to help. If this issue persists, you can reach our customer support at $1 for further assistance.
swapFetchingQuotesErrorDescription: Hmmm... something went wrong. Try again, or if errors persist, contact customer support.
swapGasFeesDetails: Gas fees are estimated and will fluctuate based on network traffic and transaction complexity.
swapGasFeesSplit: Gas fees on the previous screen are split between these two transactions.
swapGasFeesSummary: Gas fees are paid to crypto miners who process transactions on the $1 network. Wallet does not profit from gas fees.
swapLowSlippageError: Transaction may fail, max slippage too low.
swapWalletFeeDescription: We find the best price from the top liquidity sources, every time. A fee of $1% is automatically factored into this quote.
swapOnceTransactionHasProcess: Your $1 will be added to your account once this transaction has processed.
swapPriceDifference: You are about to swap $1 $2 (~$3) for $4 $5 (~$6).
swapPriceImpactTooltip: Price impact is the difference between the current market price and the amount received during transaction execution. Price impact is a function of the size of your trade relative to the size of the liquidity pool.
swapPriceUnavailableDescription: Price impact could not be determined due to lack of market price data. Please confirm that you are comfortable with the amount of tokens you are about to receive before swapping.
swapQuoteDetailsSlippageInfo: If the price changes between the time your order is placed and confirmed it‚Äôs called "slippage". Your Swap will automatically cancel if slippage exceeds your "slippage tolerance" setting.
swapQuotesExpiredErrorDescription: Please request new quotes to get the latest rates.
swapQuotesNotAvailableErrorDescription: Try adjusting the amount or slippage settings and try again.
swapReceivingInfoTooltip: This is an estimate. The exact amount depends on slippage.
swapSelectQuotePopoverDescription: Below are all the quotes gathered from multiple liquidity sources.
swapSlippageNegative: Slippage must be greater or equal to zero
swapSourceInfo: We search multiple liquidity sources (exchanges, aggregators and professional market makers) to find the best rates and lowest network fees.
swapSuggestedGasSettingToolTipMessage: Swaps are complex and time sensitive transactions. We recommend this gas fee for a good balance between cost and confidence of a successful Swap.
swapToConfirmWithHwWallet: to confirm with your hardware wallet
swapTokenAvailable: Your $1 has been added to your account.
swapTokenBalanceUnavailable: We were unable to retrieve your $1 balance
swapTokenVerificationAddedManually: This token has been added manually.
swapTokenVerificationMessage: Always confirm the token address on $1.
swapTokenVerificationSources.description: Indicates the number of token information sources that recognize the symbol + address. $1 is a decimal number.
swapTooManyDecimalsError.description: $1 is a token symbol and $2 is the max. number of decimals allowed for the token
swapVerifyTokenExplanation.message: Multiple tokens can use the same name and symbol. Check $1 to verify this is the token you're looking for.
swapVerifyTokenExplanation.description: This appears in a tooltip next to the verifyThisTokenOn message. It gives the user more information about why they should check the token on a block explorer. $1 will be the name or url of the block explorer, which will be the translation of 'etherscan' or a block explorer url specified for a custom network.
swapYourTokenBalance.description: Tells the user how much of a token they have in their balance. $1 is a decimal number amount of tokens, and $2 is a token symbol
swapsExcessiveSlippageWarning: Slippage amount is too high and will result in a bad rate. Please reduce your slippage tolerance to a value below 15%.
swapsNotEnoughForTx.message: Not enough $1 to complete this transaction
swapsNotEnoughForTx.description: Tells the user that they don't have enough of a token for a proposed swap. $1 is a token symbol
switchEthereumChainConfirmationDescripti: This will switch the selected network within Wallet to a previously added network:
switchEthereumChainConfirmationTitle: Allow this site to switch the network?
switchingNetworksCancelsPendingConfirmat: Switching networks will cancel all pending confirmations
symbolBetweenZeroTwelve: Symbol must be 11 characters or fewer.
syncWithMobileBeCareful: Make sure nobody else is looking at your screen when you scan this code
syncWithMobileComplete: Your data has been synced successfully. Enjoy the Wallet mobile app!
syncWithMobileDesc: You can sync your accounts and information with your mobile device. Open the Wallet mobile app, go to "Settings" and tap on "Sync from Browser Extension"
syncWithMobileDescNewUsers: If you just open the Wallet Mobile app for the first time, just follow the steps in your phone.
syncWithMobileScanThisCode: Scan this code with your Wallet mobile app
syncWithThreeBoxDescription: Turn on to have your settings backed up with 3Box. This feature is currently experimental; use at your own risk.
syncWithThreeBoxDisabled: 3Box has been disabled due to an error during the initial sync
thisWillCreate: This will create a new wallet and Secret Recovery Phrase
toAddress.description: $1 is the address to include in the To label. It is typically shortened first using shortenAddress
toggleTestNetworks.description: $1 is a clickable link with text defined by the 'showHide' key. The link will open to the advanced settings where users can enable the display of test networks in the network dropdown.
tokenDetectionAnnouncement: New! Improved token detection is available on Ethereum Mainnet as an experimental feature. $1
transactionCancelAttempted: Transaction cancel attempted with estimated gas fee of $1 at $2
transactionCreated: Transaction created with a value of $1 at $2.
transactionDecodingUnsupportedNetworkErr: Transaction decoding is not available for chainId $1
transactionDetailDappGasTooltip: Edit to use Wallet's recommended gas fee based on the latest block.
transactionDetailGasTooltipExplanation: Gas fees are set by the network and fluctuate based on network traffic and transaction complexity.
transactionDetailGasTooltipIntro: Gas fees are paid to crypto miners who process transactions on the $1 network. Wallet does not profit from gas fees.
transactionError: Transaction Error. Exception thrown in contract code.
transactionErrorNoContract: Trying to call a function on a non-contract address.
transactionResubmitted: Transaction resubmitted with estimated gas fee increased to $1 at $2
transactionSubmitted: Transaction submitted with estimated gas fee of $1 at $2.
troubleConnectingToWallet.message: We had trouble connecting to your $1, try reviewing $2 and try again.
troubleConnectingToWallet.description: $1 is the wallet device name; $2 is a link to wallet connection guide
troubleTokenBalances.message: We had trouble loading your token balances. You can view them
troubleTokenBalances.description: Followed by a link (here) to view token balances
trustSiteApprovePermission: By granting permission, you are allowing the following $1 to access your funds
txInsightsNotSupported: Transaction insights not supported for this contract at this time.
u2f.description: A name on an API for the browser to interact with devices that support the U2F protocol. On some browsers we use it to connect Wallet to Ledger devices.
unknownCameraError: There was an error while trying to access your camera. Please try again...
unknownQrCode: Error: We couldn't identify that QR code
unrecognizedChain.message: This custom network is not recognized. We recommend that you $1 before proceeding
unrecognizedChain.description: $1 is a clickable link with text defined by the 'unrecognizedChanLinkText' key. The link will open to instructions for users to validate custom network details.
unrecognizedChainLinkText.description: Serves as link text for the 'unrecognizedChain' key. This text will be embedded inside the translation for that key.
unsendableAsset.message: Sending collectible (ERC-721) tokens is not currently supported
unsendableAsset.description: This is an error message we show the user if they attempt to send a collectible asset type, for which currently don't support sending
urlErrorMsg: URLs require the appropriate HTTP/HTTPS prefix.
urlExistsErrorMsg: This URL is currently used by the $1 network.
useCollectibleDetectionDescription: Displaying NFTs media & data may expose your IP address to centralized servers. Third-party APIs (like OpenSea) are used to detect NFTs in your wallet. This exposes your account address with those services. Leave this disabled if you don‚Äôt want the app to pull data from those those services.
usePhishingDetectionDescription: Display a warning for phishing domains targeting Ethereum users
useTokenDetectionDescription: We use third-party APIs to detect and display new tokens sent to your wallet. Turn off if you don‚Äôt want Wallet to pull data from those services.
usedByClients: Used by a variety of different clients
verifyThisTokenDecimalOn.message: Token decimal can be found on $1
verifyThisTokenDecimalOn.description: Points the user to etherscan as a place they can verify information about a token. $1 is replaced with the translation for "etherscan"
verifyThisTokenOn.description: Points the user to etherscan as a place they can verify information about a token. $1 is replaced with the translation for "etherscan"
verifyThisUnconfirmedTokenOn.message: Verify this token on $1 and make sure this is the token you want to trade.
verifyThisUnconfirmedTokenOn.description: Points the user to etherscan as a place they can verify information about a token. $1 is replaced with the translation for "etherscan"
viewOnCustomBlockExplorer.description: $1 is the action type. e.g (Account, Transaction, Swap) and $2 is the Custom Block Exporer URL
viewOnEtherscan.description: $1 is the action type. e.g (Account, Transaction, Swap)
walletCreationSuccessDetail: You‚Äôve successfully protected your wallet. Keep your Secret Recovery Phrase safe and secret -- it‚Äôs your responsibility!
walletCreationSuccessReminder1: Wallet can‚Äôt recover your Secret Recovery Phrase.
walletCreationSuccessReminder2: Wallet will never ask you for your Secret Recovery Phrase.
walletCreationSuccessReminder3.message: $1 with anyone or risk your funds being stolen
description: $1 is separated as walletCreationSuccessReminder3BoldSection so that we can bold it
walletCreationSuccessReminder3BoldSectio: Never share your Secret Recovery Phrase
This string is localized separately from walletCreationSuccessReminder3 so that we can bold it
web3ShimUsageNotification: We noticed that the current website tried to use the removed window.web3 API. If the site appears to be broken, please click $1 for more information.
webhid.description: Refers to a interface for connecting external devices to the browser. Used for connecting ledger to the browser. Read more here https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebHID_API
welcomeExploreDescription: Store, send and spend crypto currencies and assets.
welcomeLoginDescription: Use your Wallet to login to decentralized apps - no signup needed.
welcomeToWalletIntro: Trusted by millions, Wallet is a secure wallet making the world of web3 accessible to all.
whatsNew.description: This is the title of a popup that gives users notifications about new features and updates to Wallet.
writePhrase: Write this phrase on a piece of paper and store in a secure location. If you want even more security, write it down on multiple pieces of paper and store each in 2 - 3 different locations.
xOfY.description: $1 and $2 are intended to be two numbers, where $2 is a total, and $1 is a count towards that total
xOfYPending.description: $1 and $2 are intended to be two numbers, where $2 is a total number of pending confirmations, and $1 is a count towards that total
youNeedToAllowCameraAccess: You need to allow camera access to use this feature.
zeroGasPriceOnSpeedUpError: Zero gas price on speed up
